body_html:
Stupid question: how do you run this test script? I can't find any documentation. I've done some grepping around the code base and determined that the most reasonable thing should be something like:

bazel test //tensorflow/examples/skflow

But running this gives:

WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
ERROR: no such target '//tensorflow/examples/skflow:skflow': target 'skflow' not declared in package 'tensorflow/examples/skflow' defined by /path/to/my/install/gideonite-tensorflow/tensorflow/examples/skflow/BUILD.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.727s
ERROR: Couldn't start the build. Unable to run tests.

body:
Stupid question: how do you run this test script? I can't find any documentation. I've done some grepping around the code base and determined that the most reasonable thing should be something like:

```
bazel test //tensorflow/examples/skflow
```

But running this gives:

```
WARNING: Sandboxed execution is not supported on your system and thus hermeticity of actions cannot be guaranteed. See http://bazel.io/docs/bazel-user-manual.html#sandboxing for more information. You can turn off this warning via --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing.
ERROR: no such target '//tensorflow/examples/skflow:skflow': target 'skflow' not declared in package 'tensorflow/examples/skflow' defined by /path/to/my/install/gideonite-tensorflow/tensorflow/examples/skflow/BUILD.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.727s
ERROR: Couldn't start the build. Unable to run tests.
```
